Package org.eclipse.mosaic.lib.spatial

Class QuadTree<T>

java.lang.Object
org.eclipse.mosaic.lib.spatial.QuadTree<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the item type to store inside the tree
public class QuadTree<T> extends Object
Implements a spatial index for 2-dimensional objects (on the X,Z plane) based on Quad-Tree implementation. Each leaf can store multiple objects, allowing them to be moved inside the bounds of its quad tile without removing and adding them to the tree again.

Note: Currently works only for point-based spatial items.

  • Constructor Details

    • QuadTree

      public QuadTree(SpatialItemAdapter<T> adapter, BoundingBox treeBounds)
      Creates a Quad-Tree for indexing objects of type T covering the given area.
      Parameters:
      adapter - the adapter used to determine center coordinates of any object of type T
      treeBounds - the bound of the area this tree should cover (on the X,Z plane)

    • QuadTree

      public QuadTree(SpatialItemAdapter<T> adapter, double minX, double maxX, double minZ, double maxZ)
      Creates a Quad-Tree for indexing objects of type T covering the given area.
      Parameters:
      adapter - the adapter used to determine center coordinates of any object of type T
      minX - the bounds of the area this tree should cover (on the X,Z plane)
      maxX - the bounds of the area this tree should cover (on the X,Z plane)
      minZ - the bounds of the area this tree should cover (on the X,Z plane)
      maxZ - the bounds of the area this tree should cover (on the X,Z plane)
